articles.headline: In Slap at Syria, Turkey Shelters Anti-Assad Fighters
articles.snippet: Once one of Syria’s closest allies, Turkey is hosting an armed opposition group waging an insurgency against the government of President Bashar al-Assad.
articles.abstract: Once one of Syria’s closest allies, Turkey is hosting an armed opposition group waging an insurgency against the government of President Bashar al-Assad.
articles.lead_paragraph: ANTAKYA, Turkey — Once one of Syria’s closest allies, Turkey is hosting an armed opposition group waging an insurgency against the government of President Bashar al-Assad, providing shelter to the commander and dozens of members of the group, the Free Syrian Army, and allowing them to orchestrate attacks across the border from inside a camp guarded by the Turkish military.

articles.headline: Gauging the Fallout of Another Rescue
articles.snippet: Skeptics of efforts by European officials to tackle Greece’s debt burden are saying some main elements of the agreement may not be as good as they looked initially.
articles.abstract: Skeptics of efforts by European officials to tackle Greece’s debt burden are saying some main elements of the agreement may not be as good as they looked initially.
articles.lead_paragraph: Another European plan to fix its sovereign debt problem has initiated another sharp market rally. But will the enthusiasm over the latest rescue effort last longer than the optimism that greeted past plans, only to slowly fade away?
articles.byline: By Nelson D. Schwartz and Eric Dash

articles.headline: Obama Backers Tied to Lobbies Raise Millions
articles.snippet: Despite a pledge not to take money from lobbyists, President Obama is relying on fund-raisers who are involved in lobbying for Washington consulting shops or private companies.
articles.abstract: Despite a pledge not to take money from lobbyists, President Obama is relying on fund-raisers who are involved in lobbying for Washington consulting shops or private companies.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Despite a pledge not to take money from lobbyists, President Obama has relied on prominent supporters who are active in the lobbying industry to raise millions of dollars for his re-election bid.

articles.headline: For Incoming I.B.M. Chief, Self-Confidence is Rewarded
articles.snippet: Virginia M. Rometty, who worked her way up during a 30-year career at I.B.M., is a product of the company’s longstanding commitment to diversity.
articles.abstract: Virginia M. Rometty, who worked her way up during a 30-year career at I.B.M., is a product of the company’s longstanding commitment to diversity.
articles.lead_paragraph: Early in her career, Virginia M. Rometty, I.B.M.’s next chief executive, was offered a big job, but she felt she did not have enough experience. So she told the recruiter she needed time to think about it.

articles.headline: With New Labor Contracts, Detroit Protects Turnaround
articles.snippet: The four-year contracts that Detroit’s automakers signed with the United Automobile Workers ensure that labor costs will remain manageable in the near future.
articles.abstract: The four-year contracts that Detroit’s automakers signed with the United Automobile Workers ensure that labor costs will remain manageable in the near future.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — After bankruptcies, bailouts and a decade of downsizing, America’s three large automakers wanted to ensure that expensive new labor contracts would not undermine their fragile turnarounds.

articles.headline: Debt Plan Could Deny Those Who Bet on Default
articles.snippet: Many investors have bet against Greece using billions of dollars in derivatives that turn a profit when there is a debt default.
articles.abstract: Many investors have bet against Greece using billions of dollars in derivatives that turn a profit when there is a debt default.
articles.lead_paragraph: The naysayers who have been betting against Greece may not get their big payoff.
articles.byline: By Louise Story and Julie Creswell

articles.headline: Hitches Signal Further Difficulties for Euro Zone
articles.snippet: Markets took heed as Italy’s borrowing costs rose and an Austrian bank posted a big loss.
articles.abstract: Markets took heed as Italy’s borrowing costs rose and an Austrian bank posted a big loss.
articles.lead_paragraph: Sobriety displaced euphoria in Europe on Friday as signals that the debt crisis was far from over, like higher borrowing costs for Italy, deflated a market rally that had followed a show of resolve by European leaders.
articles.byline: By Jack Ewing and David Jolly

articles.headline: A Spotlight Now Shines on Italy
articles.snippet: It is up to Silvio Berlusconi to keep Italy from becoming another Greece and plunging the world into an even more devastating financial crisis.
articles.abstract: It is up to Silvio Berlusconi to keep Italy from becoming another Greece and plunging the world into an even more devastating financial crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: It finally dawned on me this week that the value of my retirement account might depend on Silvio Berlusconi.
